definition: to cut/to throw out/to depose (from office)/to tear off

to fall/to drop/to lag behind/to lose/to go missing/to reduce/fall (in prices)/to lose (value, weight etc)/to wag/to swing/to turn/to change/to exchange/to swap/to show off/to shed (hair)/(used after certain verbs to express completion, fulfillment, removal etc)

sentences.english: The Vatican said it wanted the caption removed.
sentences.chinese: 梵蒂冈说，它希望撤掉这段文字。

sentences.english: After the rope is tightened, the device shall be removed.
sentences.chinese: 钢丝绳被卡紧后将该装置撤掉。

sentences.english: The firms have gone away. So we need to encourage the growth of local firms.
sentences.chinese: 原来的公司已经撤掉了，那就要鼓励发展地方企业。

sentences.english: But broadcasters mustn't remove all risqué humour.
sentences.chinese: 不过电台没必要把所有这些幽默都撤掉。

sentences.english: Other spike cured after 4 hours, removed installation of isolation facilities.
sentences.chinese: 等道钉固化4个小时后，撤掉安装隔离设施。

sentences.english: Online, many have demanded the dismissal of the new railway minister, Sheng Guangzu.
sentences.chinese: 在网络上，许多人要求撤掉铁道部长盛光祖。

sentences.english: Get rid of the chairs and put some podiums in the room.
sentences.chinese: 把会议室里的椅子都全部撤掉并且放一些矮平台。

definition: to withdraw/to remove (from a place)/to remove from office
to withdraw/to leave/to retreat/to pull out
as the time draws near/at the last moment/temporary/interim/ad hoc
to make (some time or space) available (for sb)
to screen/to block (sth or sb)/to shield/(protective) shield
to replace sb (personnel, sports team player etc)/substitution
to return (an item)/to send back/to go back
